Key Arguments: The legislation does not hold government or corporate media accountable for misinformation.
The bill could suppress truthful statements under the guise of combating misinformation.
Existing laws already cover threats of violence or hate speech.
The bill could interfere with free speech and peaceful protests.
There is concern about the potential for government overreach and censorship.
The bill could harm democratic processes by censoring whistleblowers and critics.
The public should have the right to appeal censorship decisions.
Notable Quotes: We must be able to speak the truth, this is why the covid misinformation from government and professional news content ruined the lives of so many ordinary Australians.
The Australian public must have a genuine and inalienable right to appeal whenever they are censored.
I don`t believe an unelected and unaccountable department like ACMA can be the sole source of control over Mis or Disinformation.
